column2: Lupus Born
Lupus are a breed of Garou who was born as and raised as a wolf, which is their natural form.
Homid Born
Homid are a breed of Garou born as and raised by humans, which is their natural form.
Metis

Metis is a rare breed of Garou. They are the offspring of two Garou who broke the Litany for love or lust. They are born in the Crinos form and that is their natural form - however, they are deformed and sterile.
Lupus
Lupus is one of the five forms a Garou can shift into that fully resemble wolves and have the full range of wolves' characteristics and abilities, as well as their own intelligence and Gifts.
Homid
Homid is a form that Garou shape-shift into in which they resembled human beings, able to mimic human characteristics, and utilize abilities only possessed by human beings
Crinos
Crinos is the war-form of the Garou. Fusing the deadliest aspects of human and beast into one body whose sole purpose is to kill and shred all enemies into pieces.
Glabro
Glabro is the near-man or "wolfman" form of the Garou. In the Glabro form, a werewolf can somewhat pass for human while still drawing on a portion of their feral power.
Hispo

Hispo is the near-wolf form of the Garou. It can be described as a massive wolf of nightmare, a throwback to prehistoric days when the dire wolves were the size of ponies. It's a form designed to hunt and kill.
Shapeshift Lupus
Transform into the wolf like "lupus" form.  While not good for interacting with humans, it is useful for hiding and intrigue.
Shapehift Crinos
Transform into the "Crinos" war form of the Garou.  This greatly increases your personal combat ability, at the expence of scaring everyone around you.
Shapeshift Homid
Transform intp the "Crinos" war form of the Garou.  This greatly increases your personal combat ability, at the expence of scaring everyone around you.
Shapeshift Glabro
Transform into the near-man or "wolfman" form of the Garou.
Shapeshift Hispo
Transform into the near-wolf form of the Garou.
Heal Wound
Use your lupine rage to heal your wound.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Severe Injury
Use your lupine rage to heal your severe injury.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Maiming
Use your lupine rage to heal your maimed body.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Eyes
Use your lupine rage to heal your blinded eyes.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Genetalia
Use your lupine rage to heal your genetalia.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Disfigurement
Use your lupine rage to heal your disfigured face.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Eye
Use your lupine rage to heal your damaged eye.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Hand
Use your lupine rage to heal your hand.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Leg
Use your lupine rage to heal your leg.  This will increase your rage.
Heal Mangling
Use your lupine rage to heal your mangled body.  This will increase your rage.
Rage
Severe Rage
Dreadful Rage
Dire Rage
Your rage is unending!  You surrender to the Wyrm! You become ravenous monster in constant frenzy.  You will be hunted until your last night.
BLOOD!
Your rage grows. You now have the Rage!
RAGE!
Your rage grows. You now have the Severe Rage!
Blood!
Your rage grows. You now have the Dreadful Rage!
Blood!
Your rage grows. You now have the Dire Rage! You have a high chance of either falling into Harano, or into such a frenzy that you become a thrall of the Wyrm!
Blood!
The only thought you can think of is for your Dire Rage.  How much longer can this go on? You fade in and out of consciouness--so blinded you are with anger. RAGE!
Blood!
Your rage decreases from direness.
RAGE!
Your rage decreases in dread.
RAGE!
Your rage decreases in severity..
RAGE!
Your thirst for blood is slaked..
But for how long?
You concentrate on your wound and begin to invoke the healing of the blood.  You feel the rage growing inside you, the beast seeking to be unchained.
Feel the power of the blood!
No. I will survive as I am. For this night...
